HOLD for a beat, then it changes: the lights flash this sign, which should explain to everyone: And a slow distant ROLL OF THUNDER in the far distance; n the SOUND of media begin to come up loud, under:

LONG SHOT down the Avenue, 400 mm lens, heat waves shimme thousands of old people, and people with children in stro moving restlessly about in the heat on those endless mile of benches. The SHOT is ON SCREEN only for a beat or two, then gone..

We are SEEING HEIDI, though we don't know it yet - she's  just another pretty 175-pound Italian girl with two kids, KIMMY, JIMMY, about four and five years old.  Right now s is a lump of browning flesh, shining with oil among rows similar ladies (mostly thinner, but all with a certain  unhealthy softness about them) laid out in rows and group across the sand.  SHOOT LOW AND LONG, so heat shimmers ri as though the heat were baking the oil out of this mob,  visible suntan oil pollution...  Heidi's transistor blast ROCK MUSIC into the air.
(Roberta Flack) REVEREND LEE, SHE SAID, LORD KNOWS I  LOVE YOU, REVEREND LEE - DO IT TO ME (etc., etc.)
...the American High Command announced  the famed 25th Cavalry Division would  be coming home!  The 25th Cavalry,  long since afoot, hardened in battle  in the jungles of World War II...

It is parked in a drab Brooklyn street.  Beside the car s SAL, medium height, also good-looking in an intense boyis way.  His eyes dart about suspiciously, the ever-watchful Sal. There is a watchful reserve in Sal that contrasts to Sonn outgoing bounciness: first impression is Sonny is all bar Sal is the bite.  Sal is dressed in impressive blue suit  style, he looks like a kid trying to impress the Godfathe He even wears a hat.  Now, matching Sal's preparations in the car, he checks his tie's alignment, shoots his cuffs is ready... Meanwhile, on their car radio:
(Amoreena) AND SHE DREAMS OF CRYSTAL STREAMS OF  DAYS GONE BY WHEN WE COULD LEAN  LAUGHING FIT TO BURST UPON EACH  OTHER...

As he turns, from the back of the car, JACKIE appears wit huge florist box, tied with ribbon.  Jackie is an eightee year old with bad complexion and in contrast to Sonny and Sal is dressed in teenage sloppiness.  Adidas, T-shirt,  bowling jacket, jeans.  He is uncertain: waits for direct from Sonny.  Sonny takes the florist box from him. We see a water truck drive down the street, followed by  Sonny's car, which drives up near bank.  It stops, Jackie gets out, crosses to bank window, peers through, then
returns to car.  Leans in, has fake conversation with Son They are waiting.  Sonny checks his watch, turns to Sal i back seat:
30 seconds, Sal...
They wait.  At appropriate moment, Sal exits car, walks t bank.  Slowly Sonny gets out.

A slightly seedy little branch bank, old yellow brick, bl varnished wood, a rubber plant, an American flag.  Throug the windows we SEE HOWARD, the aged black bank guard, in  uniform, taking down the American flag from outside.  Pas him comes Sal carrying an attache case.  He passes Howard coming toward us through the door into the bank.  As he p
as it CLICKS from 2:57 to 2:58 PM.

as he moves toward the left-hand deposit-slips desks. He picks out a car-loan application slip, then walks towa the manager's desk (as the sign on the desk proclaims) of PATRICK MULVANEY.  Sal sits down, his back to Mulvaney, f the front door of the bank.  Mulvaney is on the phone.
as Sonny bustles through in his bouncy dancer's walk.  He carries the large florist box.  He moves toward the left- hand deposit-slips desks, takes one out and begins to fil one out.

as he pulls out the keys, attached to the belt of his uni Jackie approaches the door of the bank and stops, neither nor out, as though he can't make up his mind.  Howard wat him, waiting patiently, keys in hand, folded flag under h arm.
still sitting, back to Mulvaney, watching Jackie's approa and entrance, ready to move on cue.
on Howard as he looks at Jackie, still half in, half out. Howard speaks to him:
Closing time; you want in or out?

Jackie steps in and as Howard locks the door to prevent m customers from entering, Jackie walks toward Sonny, filli out a slip at the left-hand area.  CAMERA FOLLOWS Jackie. He stops at deposit-slips desk, next to Sonny.
as if by pre-arranged signal, Sal now stands up, moves to the side of Mulvaney's desk.
You the manager?
who is still on the phone.  He gestures at the sign on hi desk that says so, and gestures for Sal to sit down.
as he sits, producing as he does a machine pistol, which holds on Mulvaney's chest, out of sight from others in th bank.
His mouth simply stops, and he stares at the gun.  Mulvan is a comic opera Irishman in his early fifties, florid... cheerful, bushy eyebrows; he acts out everything he says.
Just go on talking, like nothing was  happening, okay?
(into phone) Listen, lemme call you back.

He hangs up, and looks from the gun up to Sal's blank har face.  To his own amazement, he grins: a hopeful grin tha says: "Like me - don't hurt me."  And he's embarrassed by it.  As we watch, his smile turns sour.
Sal's absolutely unmoved face.
Jackie moves over to Sonny.
Sonny, I'm gettin' real bad vibes.
Jackie - what are you talking about?
Maybe we can take something smaller...  like a Spanish grocery.
(indicating what's  happening with Sal  and Mulvaney) It's too late - just get away from  me - don't talk to me now - go over  to your place...
Jackie moves to another deposit-slips desk - takes one ou and begins to fill it out.

as a LADY with a BABY in a stroller moves away from the T and starts to walk toward the front door.  DEBORAH is mar figures on a piece of paper at 1st Teller's cage. SYLVIA and MIRIAM stand behind her - their backs to Sonny Howard, who has put the folded flag in a plastic bag in a front desk, follows Lady toward the door.  He unlocks the door and hands the Baby a lollipop, courtesy of the bank, and she exits the bank.
glancing at clock, taking a sharp deep breath...
staring at Mulvaney.
the ruins of his smile still on his face.
straightens up from locking the door; the figure of the L and the Baby can be seen receding outside...

seeing that the bank is closed, locked in, with no custom crosses toward the front teller's cage area, carrying the florist box.  As he reaches the other side, he rips open box and takes the rifle out and aims it level onto SYLVIA BALL, the teller, who automatically takes the "closed" si and holds it in front of her face as though to protect he from the rifle.
(holding sign in front  of her face) Sorry, this window is shut...
as Mulvaney stands and yells to Sylvia...

head_text.subj: BACK OF BANK, REST ROOM AREA

text: as MARGARET, an accountant, comes out of the ladies' room starts to cross downstage toward her desk, sees what is  happening, and momentarily freezes in her tracks.
The cues have got all fucked up, but he's so programmed a ready, he can't adjust, so the speech he had ready comes now:
Okay, this is a stickup!  Nobody  move!  This is a fucking stickup! Just freeze now, goddammit!  Get  away from your desk... get in the  center - get in the center!
Sylvia and Edna start to move toward the rear of the bank toward Margaret's desk.
aghast at his own outspokenness... Sal holding the gun  levelled on him.
Okay, okay... we know it's a stickup!
(to Jackie, re: Howard) If he moves - blow his guts out... Cover him!
Jackie, staring at the real guns, turns to Sonny...
I'm sorry, Sonny... I can't make  it...
Jackie starts to move toward the front door.
Hey, for christ's sake... now...   fuckin' asshole... (turns to Sal) He can't make it.
Fuck him - let him out!
Sonny yells out at frozen Howard.
Hey... let him out!
(yells) Do what the gentleman says, Howard.

Sonny sees that Howard is useless, so he runs to Howard,  grabbing the keys from him and pulls Howard along with hi to the front door.  Jackie unlocks the door, and Jackie,  with a last apologetic glance, gives his gun to Sonny and vanishes into the sweltering afternoon.  Sonny then frisk Howard and has a sudden afterthought as he locks the door again.  He quickly unlocks it and shouts out at Jackie.
Hey, don't take the car!
(on sidewalk) Well, how'll I get home?
Take the subway.  We need the car. (as Jackie starts to  walk away) Hey, gimme the keys - the keys!
Jackie stops, fumbles for keys, crosses back to Sonny wit them.
(points to fig. desk) Sonny, there's somebody under that  desk over there... I'm sorry...
It's okay... it's okay...
Sonny turns into the bank once more, as Jackie walks off  toward the subway, pointing inside at a desk near the win as he does, to point something out to Sonny.
Sonny, re-entering the bank, speaks to Howard.
Lock it.
Sonny now crosses to desk that Jackie indicated, as every watches him, as though it's all in the game.
(taps loudly on top  of desk) Hey... get outta there!  Nobody's  gonna hurt you.

JENNY, a young, frightened girl, peeks out from under the desk, obviously afraid to reveal herself. Sonny starts to move toward the front of the bank.  Sal t so he can cover everyone.  Sonny turns to order Howard.
Pull the drapes.
Howard doesn't move.
Pulla drapes!

Howard belatedly leaps to work, pulling drapes that scree off the interior from outside.  The door has no drapes or blinds and thus when the drapes are closed there is a cor of space across the street we will always be able to see. And from which people outside will always be able to see As Howard finishes the task, he then walks back to the hu group on the rear.

on his way to the back of the bank, is digging into his j pocket; he swings around as he passes the camera that is  bolted to a wall bracket covering the tellers' area.  He  whips out a spray can and gives the lens a shot of red pa There are three cameras in all, each of which he sprays.
(grinning) No replay, folks... no alarms...
After spraying the three cameras, he has reached Mulvaney desk area.  The girls are scattering to group farther bac and Sonny and Mulvaney are heading for the vault.
(on cross to vault  with Sonny) We're hip... let's just get you all  fixed up and on your way!

MIRIAM, a young, awkward, overweight Jewish girl, chewing gum with nervous machine-like rapidity, moving toward the vault.  The gate is closed, and she holds one key and Mul the other.  They pass Sal, who now holds the others in th bank under his gun while at the vault gate.
Okay, is the vault open?
I can take care of that.
Mulvaney is about to insert his key in his lock.  Sonny  quickly reaches out and grabs Mulvaney's hand, and looks the key he has extended.  He explodes.
Son of a bitch!
He almost hits Mulvaney with his fist.
What the fuck you tryin' to do? Trip the alarm?  Use the spur key?   Use the other one...
He's grabbed the keys from Mulvaney and holds up the key  Mulvaney was going to use... we're in a:
Sonny holds the key right in the middle of the FRAME wher Mulvaney and the audience can SEE the key has a tiny  projection or spur at the end.  If this key is used, the  spur triggers a silent alarm.
I must of been outta my mind.
(furious) Well, you get your mind right.  I'm  a Catholic and I don't wanna hurt  nobody, but goddamn it, don't you  play no games with me.  Unnastand?!?
Mulvaney nods and picks out a key that is identical excep for the spur.  He shows it to Sonny.  Sonny nods.

as Mulvaney carefully uses the safe key to unlock the gat Miriam is crying as she unlocks her side.  The gate swing open.  Sonny shoves Mulvaney inside and, as he passes Mir notices her tears. She just stands there staring into his face like a hypnot chicken, the tears streaming down her face. Sonny stops, staring at her.  Mulvaney, starting to open gate, moves inside the vault, impatient...
Okay.  Let's get you on your way. Miriam - open the safe.
Miriam hesitates.
What's the matter with you?
(to Miriam) Come on, lemme load you up...
There isn't any money...
Sonny looks at Mulvaney, alarmed...
They picked it up this afternoon...
No money?! (moves inside the  vault)
There's only about four thousand in  singles, and maybe a few hundred in  larger bills... he's going to kill  us!
Sonny storms into the vault.
as Mulvaney pulls a cash drawer out to show Sonny: even w can see there isn't much there.  Sonny searches for more, finds nothing.
This is it?  What am I gonna do with  this?  Holy shit!
It's all we got.
Okay, don't worry about it.  Stick  it in the bag...

At this, Sonny pulls out a plastic bag from his pocket, h it to Miriam, who opens it and puts the money into it.  A he turns, we see that Miriam is still staring at him,  terrified, and as his rifle swings around, she reels back with a little screech of terror...
Ah, Jesus...
Let's go, Sonny.
(suddenly gentle) What are you crying for?  Jesus  Christ.  It's not your fault there's  no money...
She's afraid you're gonna shoot... (hands Sonny the bag  of money)
Sonny starts out of the vault toward the teller's area wi bag of money.  He speaks to Mulvaney.
What the hell would I shoot her for?
Miriam follows Sonny to teller's cages gate.  He carries bag.
Answer the phone!
Mulvaney crosses to his desk, picks up the receiver.  Sal follows him, yanks receiver from one ear to the other, so can hear conversation.
(to Miriam) Okay... open this.

Miriam crosses to gate, presses the necessary button and gate opens from them.  Sonny watches this carefully, noti where the buzzer button is.  He crosses in front of the d at the first cage.  He tries to open the drawer. It's obviously locked.
Okay, who's the head teller here?
I am.
Open this up!
Sylvia comes forward and unlocks the first drawer, and be to remove the cash, but Sonny grabs her hands...  alarmed
Don't take it all out!
He grabs a piece of paper or cardboard...

head_text.subj: SONNY'S HANDS AND CASH IN DRAWER

text: He takes all the singles but one out of the singles slot the drawer, leaving the bottom single in place.  It is he there by a metal clip.  He carefully slips the paper unde the clip and then removes the single. It is clear this is an automatic alarm - meanwhile...
Boy, I can't trust a one of you... I  worked in a bank, I know the alarms,  so don't try to fool around with me!

head_text.subj: BACK TO SHOT OF SONNY AND SYLVIA AND MIRIAM

text: as they move to 2nd cash drawer at 2nd teller's cage.  Sy unlocks the drawer and starts to reach in for the cash, b Sonny pushes his hand into the drawer instead.  He begins stuff the money into the bag.  Some fives, packaged with  rubber bands, in the drawer, he holds up so Sal and all c see them... He laughs!
Decoy money, right, it's marked!   Shit!

He throws it into the air so the bills flutter all around him, gaily... In the background, Mulvaney, having finishe with the phone conversation, is moving to the rear with t rest of the girls.  Sonny now moves to the 3rd cage's cas drawer... Mulvaney ends phone conversation and Sal moves over to group at vault.
(mimicking Sylvia) 'This window is shut...'
Again, the same procedure begins.  Sylvia unlocks the cas drawer and Sonny starts to scoop it out and put it into t opened plastic bag that Miriam holds.
Cheer up, you'll be the veteran of a  robbery, the bank sends you a dozen  red roses, you know that?
At this point, THE PHONE BEGINS TO RING AGAIN (#2)
(yelling to Sal) Sal, let him answer the goddamn  phones, they're driving me crazy! Look at this chicken shit!
Again, Mulvaney starts to cross back to his desk, again  followed by Sal.  Sonny yells out to Mulvaney as he cross to answer the phone.
Hey, you, manager... Don't get any  ideas, fucker... See that man there? I bark and he bites!
Believe me, I'm on your side.
My side, shit!
They move to Drawer #4.
Listen, we got young girls here...   you could watch your language.
I speak what I feel.
Hello... I'm sorry I can't talk to  you right now... I suggest you call  during banking hours tomorrow.  What  is your name?

head_text.subj: BACK ON SONNY, SYLVIA AND MIRIAM

text: Gimme the traveler's checks and the  register.
They cross toward the last drawer area (#5).  Miriam is s crying silently.  Sonny holds out the plastic bag for the checks for her.  She drops it.
Please... quit that.  It's not  necessary.
With everything in the bag, Sonny now takes the register starts to move the two girls toward the rear near the vau
Can you hurry it up?

as he moves toward the rear (Sylvia and Miriam now re-joi other women), to get a wastebasket.  Accomplishing this, starts to burn the pages of the register, tearing out pag as he does so.  It's smokey as hell, but not burning well He drops it, smoking, into the wastebasket.
(to Howard) Hey, you!  Give me the keys... We're gettin' outta here.
(gasping for breath) Huh?
Howard?
Huh?
The old man is panicked, great patches  of sweat spreading around his armpits.   He breathes in asthmatic gasps; now  he flinches at his name, as though  he's been hit.
(stands, receiver  still to ear, then  covering it with his  hand) Howard, give him the keys...
Gimme the keys to get outta here!
Howard is unable to move.  Seeing his predicament, Edna m to him and starts to unfasten his belt to remove the keys Mulvaney continues with his phone conversation.

who now crosses to Howard and Edna, losing patience with situation.  As he moves closer, Howard backs away from hi frightened by his rifle.  Seeing that, Sonny puts it down and looks over to Sal for coverage.
Sal...
As Sonny approaches Howard, he realizes that he can't get close enough.
Take it easy... just gimme the keys. I'm not gonna hurt you.  Listen,  calm down, huh?  You're gonna have a  heart attack.  Just gimme the keys...  that's all I want.
Howard gives him the keys and as Sonny starts to walk bac toward the burning register...
with Mulvaney still on the phone.
(looking past camera,  falling onto the  floor behind Mulvaney) Sonny... who's that?  Across the  street.
who now starts to move quickly toward the front of the ba being sure to hide behind the posts as he moves.
(on phone) No, it was the credit rating.  The  credit rating.  I don't know, you'd  have to find that out from him.
Sonny has now reached the front of the bank.  He carefull peeks out through the closed draperies to look outside.
A man, in a business suit, sweaty and harassed-looking, i walking from an insurance office across the street direct toward the bank... The man continues coming straight towa them and us...
Sonny starts to run back to get his gun from Margaret's d Mulvaney is still on the phone.
It was something a couple of years  ago in St. Louis, I don't know...
Sonny grabs the gun from the desk top and moves over to  Mulvaney.
The man walks straight toward the glass door, already lif his hand to shadow his eyes, so when he reaches the door, he'll be able to see inside.

Sal brings the gun up so he can shoot the man, at the sam time, crabbing himself aside so he is concealed behind  Mulvaney and the desk.  Mulvaney sees the approaching man and cups his hand over the phone.
It's the insurance guy across the  street.  He probably saw the goddamn  smoke! (motions toward smoking  register) Please!  Put out the fire!
The last few feet from the door.
who rushes through the teller's cages gate toward the  register, grabs the smoking register, throws it onto the  floor near Edna's desk, and starts to stamp it out.
I'll get some water!
Before anyone can move, Sonny grabs the gun on them all.
Nobody move! Freeze!
The women now begin to scream as real hysteria sets in. Deborah screams, collapses.
The man actually kicks the glass with his foot, then lean against the glass, shades his eyes, trying to see in.
Sorry... I can't talk now... I'll  call you back.
SOUND of hanging up.  The man is looking all around.
Get rid of him.
Howard, wave him off.  Tell him we're  closed.  Whatever...
who is useless.
who starts to move toward the front door, looking over at Sonny trying to put out the fire. CAMERA FOLLOWS MULVANEY TO THE FRONT DOOR; Sonny moves wi him, covering him all the time.
as Sonny stands behind closed venetian blinds to listen t the conversation and to cover Mulvaney.
The gun's right on your back...
Give me the keys...
Sonny hands him the keys.

He raises the gun and sights it now, and in this moment, should sense a kind of luxurious relaxation into anticipa on Sal's part.  He is smiling a little, and for the first time, looks happy, and that's what makes him seem dangero He's looking forward to an excuse to kill.  It's here now survival.  There is something almost sexual about the way settles his body down behind the weapon, getting ready fo the squeeze on the trigger, the report, the violent shove recoil against his muscles and sinews. In the background, we see Sylvia bringing Howard a cup of water.
emphasizing the small of Mulvaney's back.  The man is som he knows from across the street.  He looks worried and  mystified...
(unlocking door) What is it, Sam?
Everything's all right?  You okay?
Yeah, just a cigarette got in a  wastebasket.
Silence.  Sam stares around... thinking.
You all right?
Little smoke: like a Polish four- alarm fire, is all.
Yeah.  Well, you're okay?
Yeah, thanks for keeping an eye out.
Okay.
He's not satisfied, but he can't see anything and he can' think of anything more to say, so...
Thanks again, Sam.
I'm glad it's okay.
It's okay. [Regards to the family,  Sam.]
Mulvaney locks the door and walks inside the bank, giving the keys back to Sonny.
For God's sake, will you please go  now?  We gave you every nickel we  got.
You're goin' outside with me.  If  there's no cops around, we just split.   Otherwise, you go with us.
Mulvaney and Sonny starts to walk back toward Sal.  As th do, the PHONE BEGINS TO RING AGAIN (#3).
(to Mulvaney) Answer it.
Mulvaney shrugs helplessly.  Picks up the phone, standing desk opposite his.
He's gone?
Yeah - it's all right... let's go.
Hello, Mulvaney here...
Sal, get 'em in the vault.
Where's the money?
Get 'em in the vault!

As Sal starts to herd them into the vault (Sylvia helping Howard, still with the cup of water), Mulvaney is still o the phone.  Sonny moves down to get the money bag atop th teller's cages and we hear Mulvaney on phone.
(tired) What property is that, Mrs. Anterio? The Third Avenue property - you  already got a second mortgage on.   We discussed it before...
The girls are afraid; Miriam unlocks the gate as Sonny us Mulvaney's keys to the matching lock.
(from inside vault  area) You won't close the vault?  How can  we breathe?
No, that's okay... just close the  gate...
Sylvia, helping Howard, is the last to go through the gat As Sonny is about to lock the gate, she turns to him.
Listen, I'll never make it.  I'll  have to go to the toilet.
What's the matter... they never  housebroke you?
It's not a joke.  I got this terrible  fear of being locked in...
Goddamn women...
Ah shit.  Okay... go ahead.  Anybody  else have to go?
Me, too, please.
You see... now they all gotta go.
As Sylvia starts to move out, Sonny starts to cross ahead her.
Wait a minute - I want to check.
Mulvaney finishes his phone conversation.  He moves towar the group at the vault.
as Sonny sprints for the door to the Ladies' Room.

It is a little lounge; sitting on a couch under the windo making up her face (or painting her toenails) and listeni to her tiny transistor radio, oblivious to all that's  happened, is MARIA, heavily-painted and voluptuous Latin  girl.  Sylvia, following him in, is shocked.  She's forgo about Maria.  Now she runs over to her, puts her arms aro her.
Oh - Maria!
Who the hell is that?  God damn it! What the...
Maria is about to protest, but Sylvia grabs her and start to hustle her out.
What are you trying to pull?
I forgot she's in here.
Come on, nobody's going to the  bathroom - come on...

He moves with them back to the vault area, herds them int it.  At this point, PHONE RINGS AGAIN (#4).  Sonny moves get the empty wastebasket, shoving it into the vault for girls to use in case of emergency.  Mulvaney moves to his desk and phone. Mulvaney has by this time answered the phone, and is now  holding it out to Sonny.  HOLD THE BEAT...
(to Sonny) It's for you.

They both stare at Mulvaney.  Sonny slowly moves toward  Mulvaney.  For the first time since he entered the bank,  he's quiet and slow.  He takes the instrument and slowly  puts it to his ear.  The group from the vault now slowly  starts to move out to listen to the conversation.
(into phone) Yeah.
What are you doin' in there?
Who's this?
This is Detective Sergeant Moretti,  asshole, we got you completely by  the balls.  You don't believe me,  I'm lookin' you right in the eye. Right now, I can see you...
Who is it?

Sonny turns and looks out through the door.  Sure enough, the window of the barbershop across the street, the dim f of a man on a telephone can be SEEN looking out toward us He wears a hat in spite of the weather and a cigar is cla in his mouth.  He is an old-time, hard-nosed, uneducated, street-wise, sarcastic New York cop, outspoken, rude and  sentimental.  Right now he's a distant silhouette and a v on the telephone.
holding the phone.  Listening to the voice of his death  speaking in New York accents.
Okay?  Let's be reasonable and not  stupid and not get anybody hurt. You come to the front door with hands  folded on your head, unnastand?   Nobody's gonna shoot or...
Sonny slowly, almost sadly, puts the telephone receiver b down, cutting off the little voice at the other end.  He  looks up at Mulvaney, then to Sal.
(to Sal) It's the cops.  Shit!
How'd that happen?
(backing away from  Sonny) I swear to God... on my salary, I'm  not gonna be any hero...
I took too long.
It was the fire, asshole!
Sonny paces.
I told you, just go, get out when  you could, but no, you just got to  hang around.
Sonny is pacing back and forth, trying to figure out what do.
Oh, shit!  I gotta have time to think.
What is it?  Did you just barge in  here... He doesn't have plan.  It's  all a whim. (sarcastic) 'Rob a bank!  What not?'
...Just give me time to think...
We're all in the barrel together...
Phone continues to ring.  Sonny finally grabs it (desk  opposite Mulvaney).
(into phone) All right, bastards!  You keep away  from the bank or we start throwing  bodies out the front door one at a  time.  You got that?
A startled apologetic man's voice speaks: Now ANOTHER PHO BEGINS TO RING (#6).
I just called to ask Jenny what time  she's gonna get off.
Who's this?
It's her husband.
Sonny abruptly holds the phone out from his body at arm's length, disgusted.
Is there a Jenny here?
Nobody moves.  They all stare at him.  Finally he singles her out.
It's your husband.
Jenny starts to move toward Sonny.
What do I say?
Tell him the truth!  Tell him whatever  you tell him!
As he puts down the phone for her to pick up, Sonny reach for the other phone that is RINGING.
What a fuckin' comedy! (into phone) WNEW plays all the hits.
Listen, first off, is anybody hurt  in there?
...But you keep away from the bank  or we start throwing bodies out the  front door one at a time... You got  it?  Okay?
He hangs up the phone.  Sal looks at him.
You mean that?
What?
...The bodies out the door.
I want him to think that.
But do you mean it?
At this moment, Jenny, phone in hand, is turned to him,  respectfully like a child in an authoritarian household,  addressing her father:
He wants to know what time you think  you'll be through.

stares at her.  For the first time, he realizes how frigh she is, how serious, grotesque, and funny it all is.  He  takes the time to be tender with her, as though she were not-too-bright child in the presence of a tragedy she'll  never understand.
Tell him I don't know.

...because if you're talking about  coppin' a plea, I'm tellin' you right  now, there's no deal... I'm never  going back to prison... We got our  own deal already... Do you remember  the pact we made?  You and me and  Jackie - that night in the bar... we  were talkin' about if we get trapped  in the bank, what are you gonna do...  Right?  What did we say?  What did  we say!
We'd kill ourselves.
Does that still go?
We're not there yet.
Sonny now walks over to the ringing phone on Edna's desk. Jenny, sitting on top of the desk, thinks the call is fro her husband, starts to reach for it but as she does, Sonn grabs it away from her.
You're on the phone!
Kill them all.  Now.
It's a heavy adhesive voice that can be heard clearly  throughout the bank.
Kill them all now?  You fuckin' creep!   Don't call here again!
Sonny slams down the receiver, looks around at the group.
You see what we're dealing with? They want me to kill all of you!
What now, Sonny?
Wait a minute... I've been looking  at this all wrong... Let's look at  it the other way...
He crosses over to Sal.

Look, we gotta get a jet outta here...  outta the country.  We gotta get a  helicopter.  Okay, Sal?  We get a  helicopter on the roof to take us to  the jet and we fly to the sunny  Caribbean.  Algeria.  We got to look  at the bright side.  We got 'em by  the balls, we got the hostages, we  can get anything we want.  They gotta  give it to us.
Edna exits ladies room as Sonny crosses back to the phone picks it up.
(into phone) Get me Moretti.
Now Sonny turns and speaks to the group.

We're all gonna get outta here. You're all gonna be all right.  I'm  gonna ask for a helicopter and a  jet... and we're gonna get outta  here alive... You've all been all  right with me and as long as it stays  that way, then things are gonna be  all right - as long as you  cooperate... (into phone) Moretti, I want to talk to you.  I'm  comin' out.
Sonny slams the phone down and walks over to Sal, rifle s in his hands.

You realize, Sal, that we're gonna  get outta the country, so if you  wanna talk to somebody, do it now...  You gotta Mother or a Father? Friends? (Sal nods no) If we gotta be outside the country,  where do you wanna go?  Any country. Just name a country.
Wyoming.
(stopped for a moment) Wyoming... That's not out of the  country -- that's in the United  States... Look, I'll be back.
Sonny starts to walk toward the door.  As he does, Sal ca back to him.
Sonny!  Gimme the gun.  You don't  need that.
Sonny realizes what he's saying and crosses back to Sal a hands him the gun, then moves toward the front door.
Much as before.  Sonny steps out.  The guns start to come up.
Put them down.

The Cops lower their weapons.  Moretti comes out on the  sidewalk.  He's eating an ice cream bar, and stands seemi at ease, an island of calm control in a storm of passion  about to be let loose.  The Cops are always about to expl
Sonny, ya want somethin'?

Sonny is about to open his mouth when a medium-size dark- haired Man who has been standing among people behind the  barriers puts his head down and runs at astonishing speed right across the street towards Sonny.  He catches everyb so by surprise he is already on Sonny before anyone can d more than start to yell at him to stop.  Sonny, himself,  can't believe it!  He is slammed to the ground and the Ma begins to punch him and beat him viciously.  Cops charge and with great difficulty pull him off. YELLING on the radio network; TV Reporters and the crowd and SCREAMING for blood!
as Moretti steps in.  Sonny gets up, dazed.  The Man goes kicking and fighting Cops...
Who the hell is that?
Mulvaney stands in the door...
(to Maria's boy friend) Hey!  What the fuck you tryin' to  do?  You don't think the whole police  department can do the job?
I think he's got Maria in there, and  I see blood, man!  I wanta jam him  up...

Jesus, the Spanish!  You gotta do it  yourself, right?  Eye for an eye!   Go wan get outa here, we'll take  care of her. (turns to Sonny) You okay, Sonny?  Boy, he hung a  couple good ones on you there!
(from door; alarmed) Sal wants to see Sonny.  He says  he'll shoot unless he can see Sonny.
He means Sal.  Sonny, dazed and bleeding, reels to the do and calls in... Sal now stands alone behind 3rd pillar.
It's okay, Sal.
He turns back to face Moretti, Sylvia, Mulvaney.
(continuing; hurt,  wondering) He wanted to kill me!
It's okay, you got a lot of  protection.
Looking around, bewildered, the crowd is YELLING and now sounds unfriendly.  He is really shaken up... He shakes  himself -- stops that line and starts over in a business- like tone.
I want a helicopter to get outa here!   And a jet to take us to... (cagey) ...wherever we want to go.  Outa the  country, so no little jets.  A big  one with a bar and a piano lounge.
I don't know, Sonny.  I don't know  if the helicopters can land in here. I'll have to check it out.  I got  superiors, unnerstan?  They don't  always see eye to eye with me.  I'll  do what I can.
Sonny looks him in the eye.  Suddenly he makes kissing mo and sounds with his lips.  We know what he's referring to he thinks Moretti's trying to fuck him over.
(continuing) Sonny, be reasonable!
I want to see my wife.  I want you  to bring her down here.
Okay, what do you give me?
What do you want?
The girl hostages.
Nothin' doin'.  I give you one hostage  when you bring my wife, and one for  the helicopter, one for the jet, and  the rest can come home on the jet.
(kiss) I'll see what they'll do.
Sonny smiles and pantomimes kissing.
Okay, you pick out who you're gonna  give us.  Where's your wife?
There's Heidi.  Her body lies exactly as before, baking i the sun.  The transistor RADIO plays... she seems to be  asleep...
...the leader of the pair, a Vietnam  veteran, Sonny Abramowicz, has  demanded in return for releasing one  of the hostages that police allow  his wife to visit him at the bank.   Police spokesman...

Heidi sits bolt upright, stares at the radio, which conti to blather on.  Abruptly she begins to gather up her thin her children, in a characteristically scatter-brained and hyperactive sort of way.  Heidi is a one woman panic:  sh hustles away across the broiling sand carrying the radio  wadded up in towels, and lugging a child, crying helpless by one elbow, as though it were a handle, a silhouette ag the late afternoon sun, out of Fellini... meanwhile on th SOUND TRACK we are hearing her voice.  It is a breathless harsh childish voice that pours out the words in a torren

The transistor goes Sonny what?  I  couldn't believe my ears, so I shut  the transistor, get outta here, who  needs this?  I say Sonny didn't do  it.  It's not him to rob a bank. It's not him to hurt anybody, to  threaten anybody, to steal or do  anything wrong.  'Cause he's never  done nothin' wrong from the day I  know him.
She is stumping off into the sunset as she says these wor and we
Out of a subway crowd, she struggles, pulling the two kid by the hand, a very ordinary woman in a most ordinary New York scene...

...Only he tells me this and he tells  me that, he's with the Mafia, I say,  Sonny, where do you get the money,  you're on welfare, how can you rent  a new Eldorado, red, you don't like  the color you rent a yellow.

A working class block, dirty, shops in the first floor, t story walk-ups above... Heidi appears and runs up the sto TWO COPS get out of a squad car where they've been staked out and move up to her.  They never really get in a word  edgewise.  They follow her into the hall... Now as we CUT CLOSER to her, we will SEE Heidi's mouth in SYNC with the words...
So night before last we're at Coney  Island, he's on the rides with the  kids, an' I have this habit of goin'  in glove compartments an' all, an' I  see...
Heidi struggles up the stairs, dragging the kids -- the c following...
this gun with bullets in there, an'  I go to myself, oh God, Sonny!  That's  all I had to see, I didn't say  anything.
She's got her door unlocked.  Below and on the stairs beh the Cops, curious neighbors peer in...

Chaos out of cut-rate furniture stores.  Full of unwashed glasses, kids' clutter.  Throughout, the children rush ar unchecked.  Neighbors enter without ceremony and listen. The Cops stand, trying vainly to communicate... As they  enter...

(continuing) And things are adding in my head,  how crazy he's been acting, and in  with a bad crowd, an' I look at him,  he's yellin' at the kids like a  madman.  So inna car I said to him,  Sonny, what you gonna do with the  gun?  You gonna shoot me and dump my  body inna river or what?  I was so  scared of him, I never been scared  of Sonny never.  You know, his mother  says the cops was always at our house,  we was always fighting.  I hit him  with the jack in the car once, but I  only missed and hit myself, you should  of seen my leg.  And all he would  ever do is put on his coat and go  out.  So they say it's Sonny but I  don't believe it.
Lady, you saw him.  You saw his gun.
He might of done it, his body  functions might of done it, but not  he himself.

The group is now situated like this: 1) MULVANEY'S DESK - the TV is on; seated in his chair, f her nails is MIRIAM. Seated to her left, having pulled the chair a patron uses is MARIA, watching TV and listening to her transistor rad against her left ear, at the same time. MULVANEY (at back water cooler - will eventually move bac to his desk, sit down to Miriam's right.) 2) EDNA - is now behind the Tellers' cages, straightening the mess; she picks up the loose money that Sonny had  scattered thru the air, puts them into packets and ties t with rubber bands. 3) SAL - is seated in the rear Conference room, still hol his rifle, feet up on the table. 4) MULVANEY & DEBORAH - at the rear water cooler (from wh she will move to see what's wrong with Margaret) 5) MARGARET - seated at her desk, obviously ill, wiping h forehead, head bowed. 6) SYLVIA and JENNY - at far right table, doing a crosswo puzzle. 7) SONNY - pacing back and forth Mulvaney's desk, posing legal puzzle for Maria. Sonny, his gun now lying across the top of Mulvaney's des is pacing back and forth between the desk areas.  He's ta to Maria in particular, but anyone in earshot in general.
Let's say I put a gun to your head  and I tell you to kill a cop...  and  you did.  Who'd go to the electric  chair... you or me?
You would... you told me to do it.
But you shot him.
(joining in) But you told her to.
Yeah - But you did it.

Deborah crosses to Margaret who is ill.  Deborah goes to  Sylvia - who returns with her her to Margaret. It should begin getting dark in through here.  It is very hot and sweaty in the bank.  OPEN SCENE ON:

He is sweating, worried.  He is listening to a conversati we can HEAR... as it goes on SHOT WIDENS to reveal the ot in various postures of waiting.  Sal more disheveled, Son restlessness is unabated; he paces about like a caged ani The voice on the phone is breathy and youthful: Sonny has been listening for a long time.
Jesus Christ is coming back and he's  really pissed.
(gently) Yeah, well I don't blame him.
You know, Sonny, I used to dope a  lot, and I was into dipping?  And I  did a couple bank jobs, and the Lord  Jesus in his everlasting mercy saved  me, you know how?
Sonny is desperate to get off the phone but doesn't dare  risk the wrath of God by hanging up on this guy.  He migh have the secret after all.
No.  Look, we're kind of....
That's why I can talk to you, as an  equal, Sonny.  You got to merge your  whole soul with God.  And then you  are Him and one with the Holy Ghost.
Yeah, well... maybe you better talk  to one of these others, okay?
Sonny?  Don't send me away!  I can  help you save your soul ...
Sonny hangs up.  Deborah moves to Margaret, who is ill. goes to tell Sylvia who immediately crosses to Margaret.
The air conditioning is off or something. (Looks at Margaret) she's sick.
Sonny runs around, notices her - sees that air conditione is off.
Where's the air conditioning?
I don't know, Sonny... on the roof  somewhere I guess.
(improv. about going  out back to find the  air conditioning  mechanism) Sonny moves toward Sal in the  Conference room.  Mulvaney follows  discreetly behind him.
Sal, I'm gonna take a look at the  air conditioning.
Sonny and Mulvaney start to move out toward the back door area.
(to Mulvaney) Do you think we can turn it on?
I don't know.
At this point, Sal calls out to Sonny, and gets up to mov to him.
Sonny -
Yeah...
I never been up in a plane before.
It's nothing - it just goes up -  it's the safest thing in the world.   Safer than a car.  Don't worry about  it, Sal - it'll be all right...  they're great...
And Sonny and Mulvaney exit toward rear of bank.
Sonny and Mulvaney move toward the back door and stop und a trap door in the ceiling.  Mulvaney looks up at it.
It's gonna be up there.
As Sonny is staring up at the trap door, thinking about w to do, he hears a tiny scratching SOUND.
What's that?
Sonny, tensing like an animal, peers around wildly to loc the source of the little scratching SOUND: like mice at a steel door.
who quickly runs back toward the desk area.

Sonny races back in, grabs the gun from atop Mulvaney's d and with the cartridge in the other hand, runs back towar the back door again, jamming cartridge into rifle. At this point, Sal runs in from the Conference room, cove everyone point-blank again, yelling for Edna to join the  rest of the group.
(whispering) They're trying to come through the  door!
(to Edna) Everybody!  Back here!
Edna quickly obeys, moving quickly to the rest of the gro
as Sonny races toward Mulvaney and back door with gun.
Somebody or something is working on the other side of the door!
as he moves back from the door, turns and levels the rifl on the back door...
Sonny, if you shoot, shoot high...   my car's parked out there.

staring at the door.  He hears the continued scratching n and might even see the door knob move. Abruptly he swings the rifle up so the bullet going throu will clearly go over the head of any man, out through the transom. He FIRES.
They all scream, some of them falling to the floor, huddl together in terror.
Sonny races back into main area where Sal covers group.
(to group) Get over here!  Get over here!

A knot of half a dozen police are working at the door.  T were trying to work tubes under it to pump in gas, others were trying a nylon line to the doorknob, the idea being  that if Sonny came out that way, the moment he began to o the door the cops would yank it open, exposing him comple and gun him down.  The cops SCREAM as the SHOT comes thro the door, showering them with brick fragments.  They scra over cars, over each other, over fences, running into oth cops, who also, not knowing what's happening, turn and fl running into the crowd, which panics.

on men, women, children, cops, detectives, dogs, cats,  reporters, all in the area of the rear of the bank fleein in waves over fences, cars, etc.  A flood of people like  lemmings.  This is INTERCUT BY:
1) MARGARET fainting. 2) SAL herds group into vault area. 3) SONNY dashing back and forth into rear bank area.
Moretti, Sheldon, others come charging out, wondering wha the hell, pulling guns out.
The cops, safely distanced and back in cover, peek out at
It is okay.
What's happening?  He shot through  the door.  Is he coming out?  Can  you see in... (Etc., etc.)
reaches out his hand for a bullhorn that is thrust into i immediately.
(on bullhorn) Sonny!
A few louts in the crowd yell out in imitation:
Sonny!
Sonny!
(echoing) Sonny!
Moretti shrugs off his irritation and raises the bullhorn one more time: the crowd is ready and SCREAMS in unison a Moretti says:
Sonny!
You could hear it for a half a mile! Sonny starts to yell at Moretti.
(inside bank) What the hell you doin' back there?
Sonny, come on out!
Sonny walks over to Sal, gives him the rifle.
Sal, watch 'em... I'm goin' out.
as Sonny comes charging out.
What the fuck do you want?
They were...
You tryin' to fuck me?
No, I'm not tryin' to fuck you.
So, what were they doin'?  You're  tellin' me you had nothin' to do  with that back there?
I swear to God I had nothing to do  with it...
Bullshit... I don't walk to talk to  you...
Wait a minute... everything you asked  for is on the way...
Yeah...
Is on its way... The helicopter can't  land but we got a bus... the jet's  on its way to Kennedy... we got a  bus coming here...
You're full of shit...
Sonny, your wife's on the way...  We  reached her... your wife's on the  way... everything you asked for, you  got.
Well, what were you doin' back there?
It can't happen again... I'll do  everything I can to stop anything I  can...
You know, you're telling me that a  helicopter can't land here...
Can't land... you'd kill people...
Don't fuck with me...

I'm not... I'm not... you're gettin'  a bus... you're gettin' a bus... the  jet's comin' into Kennedy... and  your wife's on the way... what else  do you need?  What else can I get  you?  Listen, I don't know how you  can do better...  see that man over  there... the FBI guy...
Just one more explosion like that  and you're gonna see a dead body...
There won't be... there won't be...  What else do you need?  How else can  we help you?
All right... I got some hungry people  in there... I want to get some  pizza... some stuff like that...
What else?
Cokes, seven-ups... (Moretti repeats) also some aspirin...
Aspirins... okay you got it. (turns behind him to  a near-by cop) Charlie!  Six pizzas!
Okay...
Sonny turns and walks back into the bank.
as Sonny enters and walks toward Sal.
Okay... okay... all right, Sal, it's  okay.  I got everything straightened  out... it's gonna be okay.
Get over there!

Look, I talked to him and it's not  going to be a helicopter - they can't  land on top of the roof - so they're  comin' with a big...  limousine bus  and they'll take us to the airport -  and they're gonna get a jet... so  things are rollin'...  They're  movin'... I also ordered some food...  I got some pizzas for us, all right?   I got some things to drink - I got  sodas... I even asked them for  aspirins... I'm doin' what I can...  now I gotta pay for the pizza...  where are the marked bills?
He now walks behind Tellers' cages and picks up some of t decoy money that Edna had started to clean up and re-stac Mulvaney walks over to him.
Are we going to get the ball rolling?

What are you talking about?  What do  you think I'm doin'?  I'm gettin'  the ball rollin'.  I'm keeping these  people happy... I'm keeping you  happy... I gotta keep the cops cooled  out... I gotta do everything... I  gotta pay for the pizza .. I'm workin'  on it, do you know what I mean?  I'm  workin' on it... Jesus Christ!  I  gotta do it all... I got all the  ideas... you want me to give you the  gun?  You want to take it over?
Sonny walks to the front door with the money.
as Sonny appears in it.
guarded by a couple of cops.
You the guy wanted the pizza?
Sonny grabs bills from the wad he holds and thrusts them him.
It's paid for. (looks at Moretti;  Moretti nods)
Keep the change...
As the cops reach for the money, knowing it's bank money, people in the crowd yell:
Hey, over here!  Hey, robber!  How  about a thousand!  Throw some over  here!  Hey, no shit, I need an  operation, I don't even have a job... (Etc.)
Sonny holds up the money.  The crowd cheers.  He throws t wad of bills and it scatters in the air. The WIND is blowing now.  Even some cops join the ensuing melee to gather it up...

as cops move forward and try to catch the bills.  Some bl into the crowd.  Fights break out in the crowd as they  scramble for the money.  The crowd breaks the barriers an swarms after the cash.  Cops try to retrieve bills; fist  fights, arrests.

staring at the mess. Sonny also watching the people. There is in both of them the same reaction of faint disgu at the greed unleashed.  Sonny angrily hurls another bund after the first... then laughs as he watches the people  fighting. Moretti nods ironically at him.  Sonny turns and enters t bank with the food.  The fighting goes on in the street.
as Sonny enters carrying food.
Okay - Chow!
He puts it down in front of Mulvaney, on Mulvaney's desk. Mulvaney looks at it, sickly.  As Mulvaney looks up at So
You eat it first.  I don't know if  they put something in it.

Moretti, Sheldon, other top cops march fast-time toward t barrier where uniformed cops stand around a limousine tha has drawn up to the barrier.  It is full of white-haired  officials, one of them the COMMISSIONER.  He has a voice  broken by whiskey, cigars, good food and yelling at footb games. DOLLY AT A LOW DRAMATIC ANGLE WITH MORETTI AND ETC. It looks like they may be going into action.  Moretti's  attitude is not that subtly different now he's talking to brass.  Commissioner doesn't get out; he talks through wi The Commissioner's hand, pudgy and freckled with age, cov Moretti's where it rests on the door: he massages Moretti hand fondly.
Gene -- you smilin'?
No.  I never smile any more.
Whattaya think: we gonna kill any  civilians tonight, Gene?
I never make bets or guesses, that  way I'm never wrong and I never have  to pay out.
Gene, Jesus, what a bull he is!

A lot of comfortable CHUCKLES inside the limo.  The  Commissioner's hand lingers on Moretti's -- they are fond each other, these men, linked in a relationship of a life of shared experience, of attitudes, of maleness -- an  accumulation of years of jokes about being late for dinne of women waiting and women panting with desire, men secur in the bastion of their roles.  What is being passed on h is a purely emotional force of approval and acceptance fr top to bottom of a social institution that is the last to masculine society: police.  The homosexual content of thi should not be lost: it lies in the comfortable fit of the feelings, in the fact, simply, that they love each other, for what they share.
So whatsa deal?
They jet's comin' out.  But don't  let 'em off the ground.
What if we gotta kill a whole lot of  people?
Don't let 'em off the ground.
Listen.
He leans down to get close to his commissioner, because h not fooled by the camaraderie into a false sense of secur
(anticipating) If you're right I'm gonna back you a  hundred percent, you know that.
(pleasantly) Fuck you, sir - if I'm right, I don't need you.  What I want is - if I make an honest mistake I want  help.
The Commissioner nods - presses a button and the window g up to keep the air conditioning in and the heat out.
as we hear Jenny on the phone with her husband.  Sonny is doing the manual of arms with his rifle.
...well, just pick him up and hold  him.  No, he's not spoiled, he's  just got to settle his stomach after  eating.  He's used to me feeding me,  that's all.
At one point, Sonny starts to show Miriam how to hold the gun and in mock seriousness, she tries to do the manual o arms.

head_text.subj: WE DRIFT TOWARD THE BACK CONFERENCE ROOM

text: where Sal is seated at the Conference table, rifle on the table.  Edna and Sylvia are also seated there.  Maria ent
Somebody give me a cigarette.
Maria walks over to her, offering her one, then remembers
Sylvia, you don't smoke.
I never smoked before in my life but  I got a right to start now if I want  to.
You don't smoke... why do you want  to start now.
Because I'm scared, that's why. You never smoked?
I used to, but I stopped.
You stopped?  Why?
Because I don't want cancer.
You don't want cancer?  You're about  to get your head blown off, you're  worried about cancer. (to Maria) Gimme the cigarette.
Maria starts to hand one to her.
No!  I'm not kidding.  Don't you  understand?  You're pure!
Pure?
You shouldn't start now.
For God's sake!  As soon as I'm outta  this bank robbery, I'm gonna stop...  okay?
Go ahead.  Do what you want to do.   I hate to see you break a perfect  record.  You oughta take care of  your body.
My body?  What for?
Your body is the temple of the Lord.
(staring at him) You're serious!
You're really pure, you know?  You  got a perfect record.  You never  used that stuff to ruin your body,  why start now?

You know, you remind me of my 19- year-old brother - only he's got his  hair down to his knees - he looks  like something that eats berries and  roots out of the ground.  God forbid  I should say something to him like,  'Listen, if you ever smoke marijuana,  just remember that it's illegal' and  he storms outta the house.  You rob  a bank, but you keep your body pure,  is that it?
You gonna smoke the cigarette?
Yes...
Sal gets up and starts to leave the room...
(calling to him) Sal... If I die of cancer it's going  to be half your fault.
Sylvia grabs the cigarette from Maria.
(exiting) No - it's because you're weak.
Sonny continues with "Manual of Arms" business with rifle Mulvaney is on the phone.
(overlapping Janet  into phone) Mulvaney... (listens)
(into phone) I don't know.
(to Sonny) It's for you.  Moretti.

Yeah?

He comes alert, looks around at Sal, nods, and starts for the door of the bank, turns to Sal.
(gives him gun) They've got my wife.  They're bringing  her in.

with Moretti and others as they move to intercept the pol car where it will stop on the corner. The back door opens and an cop gets out, also grinning.  They look around toward Son as his wife gets out of the police car, on this side. who doesn't hear Sonny calling, the detectives and Morett start to take him to the barbershop.

who dashes toward the bank door, enters.

as Sonny comes running in.  Sylvia is now showing off her new-found expertise with a cigarette to Miriam, Jenny and Deborah, seated around Edna's desk.  (Deborah is talking the phone.) where Moretti and cops are trying to revive Leon.  A cop the phone turns to Moretti.

Okay.
