(referring to Sal) You know, I don't know him very well -  but he's not gay... and he's not  going back to prison...  One time  when he was in prison, they gang- banged him; 13 years old and eight  guys gave it to him...  So Sal isn't  goin' back to prison, no way.
I'm sorry.
You know... I like you people... I really do.
We like you, too.

You know - I had a job once.  I used  to work in a bank.  I had been  training... I used to have a boss...  Mr. Don Frio... he wore a toupee...  I wonder if you'd hire me if I came  in here and asked you for a job...
Would I hire you?
Yeah.
Why not?
(grinning) I don't think so.
Sonny walks back toward Sal.
I told you -- they're sending a jet. It's all worked out...
But doubt hangs in the air like a pall...
looking at him.  Implacable.  This tension between them o the question of Sonny's loyalty must be kept constantly a with CUTS and looks, over dialogue...
Somebody give me another cigarette.
Sal turns to look at her reproachfully.

I wish somebody would tell me I'm  gonna live long enough for it to be  a habit.  My parent, she'll be okay. My husband, he'll be okay.  I even  know who the bum is gonna marry.   Terrific.  She'll take good care of  him.
Girls, I wanta apologize.  For my  language back there.
Embarrassed, he walks toward the rest of group in the rea stands by Edna's desk.
Ladies... I want to apologize for my  language back there. (he walks over to his  desk, sits down)
Sonny exits Conference Room and moves downstage.
(amazed) What'd you say?  I didn't hear you  say anything.
They think for a moment.
He said the 'F' word.
They stare at her incredulously. Someone giggles.
What?
The 'F' word.  He did.  He said the  'F' word.

Edna crosses to her desk - disgusted - and starts to tidy up. The giggle catches the edge of their panic and anxiety an sweeps them into uncontrollable giggles and laughter: Son roars.  Sal and Edna alone remain unsmiling.  After a few seconds they force themselves to stop, to behave like the should under the circumstances.  They are gasping and cry Then...
What's so funny?
Well, I'm a Christian, and my ears  are not garbage cans.
It sets them off again.  They howl and giggle and laugh. Until at last they run down again.  At this point, Sal ru out of Conference Room.
Who's that?
He has seen something in the middle of the street, and no
as they all turn to look out through the door.

Backlighted by the floodlights in the middle of street  escorted by Sheldon, stands a figure, dumpy and gray,  tentatively waving, a figure that bends over baby carriag in the park, picks beans one by one out of supermarket bi lip reads get-well cards in pharmacies. They hear Sheldon, outside, on bullhorn:
Sonny!  Could you come out, please? Could you come out, please?
It's my mother.  Who needs this shit?
But as a dutiful son he starts for the front of the bank.

as Sonny walks to his MOTHER.  Baker tactfully moves away leaving the two of them in the center of the floodlighted street.  Again the crowd can be HEARD but not seen; armed police fringe the lights and shadows, in B.G.
What do you want here, Ma?  You could  of watched it on TV.
My God, Sonny - you oughtta see - - Alla Brooklyn is here!  On all 3  networks!
Mom - I got it all worked out; it's  over.  The best thing is you go home.   Watch it on TV.
I talked to the FBI, I told them  about you, they said if you just  come outta the bank it's gonna be  okay.
You did what?  Who did you talk to? What for?
Well, I'm only trying to get you  outta this.  I told them you were in  Vietnam, you always had good jobs,  you were with Goldwater at the '64  convention, but you had marital  problems...
Oh my God, mother!
I said you were never a faggot.
Don't talk to them anymore.  Sal and  me are getting a jet, we're going to  Algeria - I'll write you from there.
He was very understanding - you ought  to talk to him... Algeria?
We can't stay here.
Oh my God!  I don't understand.  If  you needed money, why couldn't you  come to me?  Everything I got is  yours.  I got two hundred and maybe  twenty-five in the savings.  It's  yours.  You know it.
Sonny abruptly realizes he is getting sidetracked by Mom like always.  Tries to get it back again.
Mom - they're sending a bus to take  us to the airport.  You understand? If you're here - they're not gonna  send it.  They'll think I'm gonna  come out with you.
What's wrong with that?  The FBI was  very understanding when I explained  it to him.  Everybody knows it isn't  you... It's the pressures from your  home life.
For God's sake don't start in on  Heidi again...
Did I say a thing against her?  God  forbid I should say anything against  that fat cunt.
Mom.  Mom.  There are some things a  mother shouldn't say in front of her  son.
If she comes down here, so help me  I'm gonna mash her brains in.   Everything in your life was sunlight  and roses until you met her.  Since  then, forget it.
She doesn't have anything to do with  it!  You understand that?  Mother?   This is me!

I know you wouldn't need Leon if  Heidi was treating you right.  The  thing I don't understand is why you  come out and sleep with Heidi anyway?   You got two kids on welfare now.   What're you goin' to bed with her,  you don't have enough with one wife  and two kids on welfare, you want a  wife and three kids on welfare?
(this is old stuff) Not now, Mom, please.
What'll you do?  Come out.
(patiently - I told  you a hundred times) I can't, Mom.  If I come out Sal  will kill them.
Oh. (she thinks for a  moment) Run.
What the hell for?  Twenty-five years  in the pen?
Maybe...
Maybe!  Aw Christ, what dreams you  live on!  Maybe what?
She stares at him.  He talks slowly and carefully to her.

I'm a fuckup and an outcast.  There  isn't one single person in my life I  haven't hurt through my love.  You  understand that?  I'm the most  dangerous person in the world, because  if I love you, watch out, you're  gonna get fucked, fucked over and  fucked out!
No!
Did Pop come down?
No.  This really pissed him off,  Sonny.  He says you're dead.  He  says he doesn't have a son.
He's right.  You shoulda done what  he did.  Go home. (embraces her) Don't talk to the FBI anymore.
He walks away and moves toward the bank door.
Her desperate smile, apologetic and false at the same tim glistens with a mother's tears.  After a long beat:
I remember how beautiful you were. As a baby you were so beautiful.  We  had such hopes.

as Sonny enters and stops, controlling his emotions.  He  walks toward Mulvaney, who is putting visitor's chair bac into position, then waters his plant. Maria and Miriam are still dancing; Margaret is at her de Sal, Jenny and Deborah are in the Conference Room; Sylvia still behind Tellers' Cages.
Mister Mulvaney?
Yeah?
Are you a lawyer?
No.  I had some legal training, but...
I want to dictate my will.  I need a  notary?
I'm a notary.
She leaves Tellers' Cages area, crosses to Sonny, grabbin pen from Edna's desk on the way.  Sonny's urgent mood rea them.  Sylvia gets note pad from Mulvaney.  Takes the  dictation...
Being of sound mind and body, and  all that shit...
Sylvia nods: got it.

To my darling wife Leon whom I love  as no other man has loved another  man in all eternity, I leave $2,700  from my $10,000 life insurance policy,  to be used for your sex change  operation.  If there is money left  over it is to go to you on the first  anniversary of my death, at my grave.   I expect you to be a real woman then,  and your life full of happiness and  joy.  To my sweet wife, Heidi, five  thousand from the same policy.  You  are the only woman I have ever loved,  and I re-pledge my love to you in  this sad moment, and to little Kimmy  and Jimmy.  I hope you remember me,  Jimmy.  You are the little man of  the family now, and will have to  look after them for me.  To my mother  I ask forgiveness.  You don't  understand the things I did and said,  but I'm me, and I'm different.  I  leave you, the rest of the policy  and my stamp collection.  I want a  military funeral and am entitled to  one free of charge.  Life and love  are not easy and we have to bend a  lot.  I hope you find the places and  the people to make you all happy as  I could not.  God bless you and watch  over you, as I shall, until we are  joined in the hereafter, sweet Leon,  my Heidi, dearest Kimmy and Jimmy,  and my mother.  Sonny... here I'll  spell the last name...
He sits and writes it for Sylvia.
Type that up and I'll sign it.
Nobody says anything about this document.  What is there say?  Sylvia walks to her desk at the front of the bank,  near the window, and begins typing.
The restless crowd STIRS, sensing something happening.   Turning to see something coming.

The Cops gear up their weapons: radios CRACKLE.  Somethin a vehicle, is moving through the crowd, Cops shoving peop aside to let it through.  The Old Lady pays no attention. She is down to one of the very last pieces of the puzzle is searching for the spot for it.

head_text.subj: CLEAR PLACE IN FRONT OF BANK

text: as the vehicle clears the crowd and slowly draws up in fr It is a long airport limousine of the type with many door It stops.  Everyone's attention is on it.  A black DRIVER gets out, a gay Afro knit on his head, coke dealer's shad for the cognoscenti, one very long little finger nail, a  nifty Van Dyke style beard and one gold front tooth.  He  looks around, holding a sheet of paper.  Sheldon, others, approach.  They are looking into the vehicles, opening do checking tires, etc.
Sonny appears.  He strides to the limo.
Okay.  Get away from it.
After a moment the Cops all move back.  Sonny opens the f door and begins to check it out.  The Driver starts to mo away...
These seats come out?
Yeah.
Together they remove the seat so Sonny can check for guns concealed below, etc.  Improvise to fit conditions of the car.
(dawning on him) Jesus, you're the man!
Come on, what's under this?
They pry up a seat and look under, etc., all through:
I was lookin' at it.  I saw you,  man!  Jesus!  You oughta see yourself!   You wouldn't believe it.
Yes, I would.

God damn it, Sheila isn't gonna  believe it.  They just call in and  say gas up a stretchout and get it  down to (address in Brooklyn) and I say, 'shit, another load of  Elks for the massage parlors.'
(finished) Okay.
Driver stands up, getting a good look at Sonny.
Well, by God I'm gonna remember you!
And he turns and walks away. Driver stops, uncertainly.  Cops grab him to hustle him a Sheldon steps forward with a neat twenty-years-younger ca copy of himself...
Here's your driver, this is agent  Murphy.
Sonny and Murphy.  Sonny eyes Murphy,  thinks, then begins to frisk Murphy.   He finds nothing.
He stands up and eyes Murphy.  He just doesn't like it.
I don't want him.
What can he do, he's clean...
Gimme the black guy...
The Driver is still close enough to hear...
Aw, hey...
(overlapping everybody) Come on, nobody's gonna get hurt. If they were gonna shoot, they'd  shoot now.
I can't allow that, Sonny...
You can't allow!  I'm running this  thing, what gives you the idea you  can say shit? (to Driver) Come on.  I'll pay you.  Whatta you  want?  Two hundred?  A thousand?
The Driver looks around desperately to the FBI, to get hi out of this.
Don't look at him.  I'm running this.

Pause.  Sheldon finally reluctantly nods.  Sonny motions him (the Driver) to step forward.  Before he can get in t car, Sonny stops him.  Signals to him to get ready.  Give him a thorough pat search.  Thighs, the whole bit.

It is tense.  The Driver seems uptight.  Sonny finds noth until he touches a breast pocket.  The Driver is very upt Sonny reaches in, pulls out a -- tiny bottle, with a coke spoon chained to the lid.  Before Sheldon can see it, but the audience has, Sonny shoves it back, grins, slaps the  Driver on the buns.  The Driver laughs delightedly. He was afraid he'd get busted for the dope: the drive wil be a cakewalk.
You'll be okay.
(to FBI) You men shoot, aim for the white  meat!
He loves the joke!  They act as though they hadn't heard. Sonny slaps him playfully on the arm and smiling turns to Sheldon.
I want him.
He points at Murphy.  Sheldon stands there speechless. Driver stares at Sonny, his smile fading.
(delighted) What do you think you're dealing  with, an idiot!
Sheldon nods to Driver and Murphy.  Murphy resumes role a driver of the limo.  Driver gets out.
So long, copper.
as they position the stretchout in front of the bank.  It can be seen from inside.  The FBI men stand well back fro it.  Murphy stands by the door.  He also can be seen.
Okay, Sonny?  You follow my car.
Murphy nods.  Sonny is satisfied and turns to the bank, t Murphy into vestibule, indicating for him to stay there. Sonny continues toward group at rear.

Sylvia is finishing her typing.  The girls and Mulvaney a slowly getting ready.  Deborah is getting her purse out o Margaret's desk drawer; Margaret gathering her own purse, books, etc.; Jenny is getting her purse from Edna's desk Edna gathers up her belongings; Mulvaney is seated at his desk; Miriam is at her desk, by the front door. Sal stands with his gun ready.  [As Sonny enters and take up his gun, Sal carefully and methodically begins to redr himself, comb his rumpled hair, knotting his tie carefull

as he rebuilds his sartorial image before the various  reflecting surfaces of the bank, knotting his tie in a gl partition, checking his suit for wrinkles in a glass door etc.  Meanwhile we are seeing the following, which Sal  ignores:
Hey, let's get ready!
(gets up, walks to  Sonny) Sonny - Here's your document.
looking at the will, taking up pen.
watching him with compassion.
Sonny signs fast and firmly...
Sylvia's notary seal clamps and imprints the paper.
Okay, okay, okay!  What a bunch of  cold fish.  It's an adventure! Everybody's gonna remember you the  rest of your lives, the day you got  held up and kidnapped... hey!
His eye has struck some reminder.  They handle this.
You got Bank Americard?
(tired) What now, Sonny?
(gathers money from  near-by money bag) Listen, I owe a couple hundred  dollars!  I don't wanta leave owing  anybody anything!  A clean slate, a  new leaf...
He plunks his card down before Sylvia.
(continuing) I paying off. (money from attached  case) Here.  Two hundred should do it.
They start the action of filing the form and accepting th money... Sonny stops them...
Just give me a receipt.  Hey, Sal,  you okay?
(deep in his hair or  tie or?) Okay, Sonny.
All right. (accepts receipt)
Here's your document, Sonny.
Yeah - it looks real official.
They are ready.  A moment in the dark.  Sonny holds out t will to Mulvaney.
Hold it for me?

Mulvaney takes it.  Sonny shakes his hand.  Suddenly,  emotionally, he embraces Sylvia.  Suddenly they are all s silent goodbyes.  Shaking hands all around, formally. Only Sal is left untouched, standing apart, watching them in the dark.
Everyone waits in silence.  The lights.  The limo.  The D waiting in the driver's seat.  After a beat the door begi to open.
as Cops' guns are brought to bear.  On the apartment fire escape the Old Lady is asleep, her puzzle complete.  The  snipers raise their rifles.

Sheldon stands there.  The police radio network CRACKLES: "They're coming out.  Perpetrators and hostages together. Only authorized personnel may previously authorized, and  etc."  Sheldon's eyes go to:
A middle-aged Man who looks like an overweight accountant in flak vest and helmet that seems too small, aiming thro a telescopic sight at:
(letting Murphy out  first; yells outside) Get away from the car!

Something that looks like a multi-legged animal emerges. is Sonny and Sal in the center of a tight group of the gi and Mulvaney, so they are completely protected on all sid by hostages.  Over their heads is thrown some drapes from the bank that further prevent the police from drawing a c head on Sonny or Sal without hitting a girl.  In fact the can't be seen at all.  This weird apparition appears,  hesitates.  The crowd YELLS: "SHOOT!"  CHOREOGRAPH THE AC so the group hesitates, takes a step forward, then it's c Sonny can't see well enough to go direct to the car, and girls are uncertain which direction to go in, not having  been briefed.  So they stumble about, make false starts, finally arrive at the car, where one girl gets into the s row of seats behind the Driver.  Then Sonny slides across next to Driver.
The police have no chance to shoot.  The group looks like bewildered centipede finding its way.  Mulvaney detaches  himself from the group and slips into the front seat, on  Sonny's right.
standing alone, outside filled-up limo.  Sheldon walks ov to Mulvaney's window.
(to Sheldon) Okay - you got your one.
(to Murphy) You follow my car. (he moves off)

Maria gets in the rear-most row of seats.  Sal next to he in the middle and then another girl.  One woman, Edna, a  plain middle-aged woman who has not said a word until now left over.  She stands by the side of the limo as the doo close and this phase of the operation ends, without misha
(elated) Fuck!  We did it!
(to Edna) Goodbye, honey.  Wish us luck!
Edna pecks out dry little kisses to the nearest girls.
as Edna pecks... goodbye.
I'll be a son of a bitch -- we're  all okay!  Hey, man!  Honk the horn. Let's go!
Sal has his gun pointed on back of Driver's head.
Hey, Sal - do me a favor... point  that gun up, huh?  We hit a bump and  the fuckin' gun'll go off.
The Driver honks the HORN: they're ready.  The crowd SCRE Cops keep jockeying for position, but there is no way to a shot in.
No emotion.  He steps into his car, a police car pulls up behind, and the procession starts to pull slowly toward t crowd.

As the limo pulls away, she is bewildered by the rush of  police, bank people, FBI men who stream past her, ignorin her, all pouring into the bank.  TV crews move by and fin one stops to interview her.
being rammed through the jam of Cops and screaming people trying to get a last look.  The hostages looking out, wan worried.  Sonny and Sal inside, alert, ready with guns.
Sal - please keep that gun pointed  up, huh?

from inside the limo.  The faces of the poor, the excited the vicious the curious, and in ONE SHOT some of the peop from the Gay Liberation Movement carrying hastily lettere signs: one protesting Sonny: YOU ARE AN INSULT TO YOUR KIND
And another: WE LOVE LOVE LOVE YOU SONNY!

Their scared and wan faces swim past in the mob.  Sonny's mother is briefly seen looking out of the barber shop win alone and forgotten.  The Cops stare heavily, sullen with anger. Now the limo is moving faster.  People are running alongs YELLING insults, trying to see in, asking for hand-outs, they are going faster.  Inside, they say nothing.  Up ahe Sheldon's car flashes a red light.  Behind, the police ca does the same.
as the procession moves through Brooklyn.
A helicopter follows above them.
They move along, followed by a HONKING parade of kibitzin cars, like a Mexican wedding.
They turn onto the thruway, trying to out-distance the ca tagging along.
Silence.  Sonny and Sal hold their rifles ready between t knees.

as they veer off the thruway, a barely seen Guard swings  open a gate and they ROAR through.  The Guard pushes the  gate to, and the following caravan of cars brakes, skids a pile-up of fender bender accidents begin, cars going in the fence and each other.
Cars are strewn all around.  Doors open and Drivers leap ready to YELL and do battle.  The Cops guard the now clos gate.
Distant lights, some moving.  Total darkness.  The FBI ca the limo, the following police car move across the darkne
They sit quiet, following the FBI car.  The FBI car stops They stop.  Silence.
Murphy, can you see what they're  doing?
He's still got some arrangements to  make.

Sheldon is getting out of the car up ahead.  Sonny and Sa and all of them come alert.  As Sheldon and the other FBI men get out of their car, a pair of aircraft landing ligh become visible, taxiing towards the limo.
There it is, Sal.  Sal?
I'm here.
Oh, Jesus!  Hey.  How about food? I forgot to ask to have food on board.
Sheldon has been walking down to the limo.  He stops besi Mulvaney and KNOCKS on the window.  Mulvaney rolls it dow
That's the jet.  You give us one  more, now.  That's the deal...
Okay.  Which one goes?
There is silence inside the limo.  Mulvaney turns to Sylv
Sylvia?
From a handkerchief, Sylvia draws a slip of paper.
It's Maria.  Go on, honey.
They open the door.  They urge her out, and Maria goes wi a show of reluctance.
As she stands up outside she is revealed to have a rosary she's counting.  IMPROVISE goodbyes, tearful and fearful around.  Then:
I pray for your safety... (meaning Sonny and  Sal) ...Sal?  Because I know it's your  first plane trip.  Don't be scared,  you know? (gives him her rosary)
And Maria walks away.  Now the plane has taxied into posi where it can be seen in floodlights.  It looks big and  impressive.  We know the FBI has snipers ringing it.
I ain't eaten all day.  I just  realized it.
We'll have hamburgers on the plane. You ready?
(turns to Sal again) Sal, keep it up, huh?  The gun -  please...
looking at the plane, grasping his money and his gun.  Th rifle stands straight up between his legs.  Sheldon leans down, peering in at him.
What do you think, Sal?  You ready  to go?

in front of Sonny, behind Mulvaney.  For the first time h smiles.  He realizes that escape is within their grasp. smile transforms him from a formidable Mafia imitation in an utterly sweet and defenseless youth.
(gun pointing high) Hey, Sonny - You did it!
Let's move it, goddamn it.
(to Driver) You ready to get out first?
Yes.

Driver starts to turn in the driver's seat! Sheldon brings up his hands to reach through the open win to grab Sonny's rifle barrel, pushes it away, aiming out  windshield. Mulvaney sees them beginning their move and starts to duc Sal begins to see movement out of the corner of his eyes is barely beginning to react.

head_text.subj: DRIVER TURNING HAS A GUN OVER THE BACK OF THE SEAT

text: Sonny sees it, and Sheldon's hand grabbing the barrel of gun at the same moment. Sheldon drives hard into the side of the limo, reaching i Mulvaney grabs the girl next to him and pulls her by the  hair down toward the floor. Sal, open-mouthed with amazement, is a split-second late  bringing his gun up. Driver completes his turn and has his gun leveled at Sal  between Miriam and Margaret in middle row. Sheldon grabs his rifle barrel and pulls hard.  Sonny let it go. Sal stares at the gun barrel, trying to get his gun up... Driver FIRES. Mulvaney hits the floor. Sheldon holds Sonny's gun. Sonny, CLOSE, watches. Sal, hit, slams back into the seat; the gun flies upward. Another SHOT hits him, flinging his head back. Driver holds his third shot, turns to Sonny - holds gun t his temple. Sonny looks down so he can see fully as: Sal's head snaps back for a split second and stares direc into Sonny's eyes, upside down. He stares sadly, into Sonny's eyes.  As though he knew it all along -- betrayed. And dies. The SHOT is ECHOING.  Now SCREAMS, YELLS, SLAMMING doors, panic... Sonny's voice:  "Shoot me!  For God's sake, shoo me!"

They come pouring out of the limo, scrambling frantically away from it.  The limo -- the people fleeing it.  Agents pull people away from the car. Driver and Sheldon and Cops peer into the back.  Sal's bo lies slumped. Driver, Sheldon, other Cops stand about, recovering.  No makes the slightest sort of congratulatory move, it was j another job.  Driver clears his weapon, hands it to Sheld to be filed in case of investigation.
They hug, cry, laugh, jump up and down: they're alive!
(to Mulvaney) I been dying to do this for years!
And she kisses him hard in the mouth.  He laughs and kiss back...
Tears are beginning to flood past his defenses:
You are under arrest.  You have the  right to remain silent.  You have  the right to counsel to be present,  during your interrogation. (etc.)
His voice is dry, as though he were reciting from memory  something he learned in a language he doesn't understand.
like a Warhol interview on TV.  Segue VOICE TRACK.
Well, I don't see how Sonny can  survive in prison, he was very loud,  very boisterous.  He was obnoxious.
being manipulated like so much beef by impersonal FBI  agents...
He was very hard to live with...
He made me laugh.

Remnants of the crowd of sightseers, being interviewed by men avid for more, more, more news... these are people am the group that held up the big banner earlier: now we see them up CLOSE.  They're folding up their banner.  A very  ordinary-looking YOUNG GUY.
I love him.  He put an end to all  that pansy limp wristed shit!
They're getting off his belt, his shoe laces...
Because he always had a way of getting  out, always in the army he was AWOL...
manacled and helpless.  He is twisted into some yet more  uncomfortable position by the uncaring Agents.
I can't help thinking how he might  ring the bell one of these days. That's why I'm nervous, because I'm  always thinking some day he's gonna  come along and ring the bell...
THROUGH THE SHOT Sal's body is carried, Sonny, seeing it of the corner of his eye.  He tries to look...
Keep your eyes front.
A faded, rattled woman, perhaps a little drunk...
How did you know your son was  involved?
It was on the TV.
When was the last time you saw Sal?
Oh, a long time.  Because I kept  asking my husband where the heck  could Junior be?  He wasn't around  here.  I thought maybe he was in  prison or some place.
Did you know he was a homosexual?
No, not until after they killed him.
Did you always call him Junior.
Yeah.
Do you remember anything else about  Sal?
No, that's all.
Sonny isn't even listening... he sees something o.s.:
Hey!
The hostages moving toward a car to take them home are pa nearby and turn to look at him...
Goodbye!  You were terrific!  Mouth! You're beautiful!  See you!

They stare at him; they've already begun to forget him: t moment in the bank when they said their goodbyes is alrea receding from their consciousness.  Their smiles are forc and they don't really know what to say.
Ah, Sonny!  Good luck, you know?
You were terrific, too!
Hey.  It's raining.
And, as the first welcome drops of cooling rain fall, the begin to move fast...
looking after them.  The rain hitting his face... the  adventure is over.  But the everlasting smile overtakes h
I'm glad.  Life is easier with him  in prison.
It would be like always, the bell  would ring, we'd have a ball.

head_text.subj: SINCE THERE WILL BE NO BEGINNING TITLE OR CREDITS, THE PI
LOGO WILL FLASH ON SCREEN NOW, AND END MUSIC UP
AS PACINO'S CREDIT IS SEEN, OVER A STILL OF HIM FROM THE

head_text.speaker/title: SONNY IS SERVING TWENTY-FIVE YEARS IN FEDERAL PRISON.

text: LEON IS NOW A WOMAN NAMED LANA.

head_text.speaker/title: HEIDI LIVES WITH HER CHILDREN ON WELFARE.
